intro: Diouratea surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from yellow to red. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in swampy areas or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens in warm climates.
